name: clethra
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a kind of small tree with small, white or pinkish flowers that grow in clusters (= groups close together): We like to include late-flowering shrubs such as hydrangea and clethra in our garden. Clethra can be deciduous or evergreen trees or shrubs, with simple leaves and small, fragrant, usually white, bell-shaped flowers.
More examplesFewer examplesThe garden is full of scented plants: viburnums, philadelphus, azaleas, jasmine and clethra all add sweetness to the air.Prune late summer and autumn flowering shrubs like butterfly bush (Buddleia), clethra and hydrangea well before cold winter weather.Sweet pepper bush is an American shrub (Clethra alnifolia), with racemes of fragrant white flowers.
